title: CS-LIT
description: CS-LIT, aka "Computer Science Like I'm Ten," is a web community platform featured on Product Hunt, where users explain complex CS subjects using everyday analogies.

This fully functional product enables users to sign up, contribute, and explore analogies for challenging CS topics. As the sole developer, I built CS-LIT from the ground up, embracing the project as both a learning experience and a personal challenge.
The platform serves as a collaborative space where individuals can share their unique perspectives, making computer science more accessible and enjoyable for learners of all levels.
features: User Registration, Login, and Analogy Sharing.
Login Options: Social login providers, email magic link.
Dedicated Auth pages for login and registration.
Fully typesafe architecture (back to front) using tRPC for API.
Redux state manager chosen for handling growing complexities in states.
Opportunity to learn Redux during project development.
Unit tests via Vitest and End-to-end (e2e) tests using Cypress.
Docker implementation for flexible deployment.
Handled Error boundaries with dedicated error pages.
Descriptive error messages for better user experience.
Zod used for robust data validation.
Responsive design for optimal user experience.
Clean code and organized folder structure.
Share analogies via link or convert DOM into an image using html2canvas.
Commenting system for user interaction.
Voting and validation system for analogies.
Code pasting with syntax highlighting support.
Markdown support for enhanced content formatting.
Search system with debounce for finding topics.
Infinite scroll using React Query for every list of data.
Full admin panel for publishing, editing, or deleting entities.
Utilized React Query for stale-while-revalidate fetching and implemented skeleton loadings for better UX.
challenges: Led the development and deployment of CS-LIT, a web community platform, featured on Product Hunt, demonstrating project management and leadership skills.
Implemented a fully functional authentication system, utilizing various technologies, ensuring secure user interactions and data privacy.
Overcame performance bottlenecks through efficient caching and optimization techniques, resulting in a responsive and seamless user experience.
Addressed complex user feedback promptly, enhancing user satisfaction and retention rates.
Navigated challenges of integrating multiple third-party APIs for various functionalities, showcasing adaptability and problem-solving skills.
Achieved high test coverage, ensuring robustness and reliability of the platform, and demonstrating a commitment to quality.
Successfully implemented continuous integration and deployment pipelines, streamlining development workflow and ensuring efficient project delivery.
Acquired proficiency in Redux state management during project development, demonstrating a proactive approach to learning and skill acquisition.
Reflecting on the project, gained valuable insights into project management and prioritization, shaping future career aspirations in software development.
Demonstrated the impact of the project through positive feedback from the Product Hunt community and increased engagement metrics.

title: this.covered
description: Introducing "this.covered" — a playful and client-side website crafted to empower individuals in enhancing their LinkedIn profiles with eye-catching header images.

With the tagline "Wanna get discovered? You got this.covered!", the platform aims to elevate personal branding by offering a simple and enjoyable image creation experience. Utilizing the Unsplash API, users can easily find and customize header images that resonate with their professional identity. Elevate your online presence with "this.covered" and make a lasting impression.

title: Futpal
description: Futpal is a web application tailored for Fantasy Premier League (FPL) enthusiasts, designed to provide a toolkit for FPL managers seeking to elevate their game.

With live Premier League game results sourced from a third-party API, users can stay on top of the action in real time. The application goes beyond the surface, offering granular in-game fantasy statistics and numbers retrieved from the unofficial FPL API, by overcoming the classic CORS problem.
Futpal aims to empower FPL managers with the insights and tools they need to make strategic decisions and stay ahead in the fantasy football realm.
descriptionShort: Short description for the fourth project.
features: Tailored for Fantasy Premier League (FPL) enthusiasts.
Live Premier League game results from a third-party API for real-time updates.
Granular in-game fantasy statistics and numbers retrieved from the unofficial FPL API.
Overcame CORS problem for comprehensive data access.
In-App Currency system for user transactions.
Empowers FPL managers with insights and tools for strategic decision-making.
Opportunity to learn about PWA (Progressive Web App).
Utilized react useContext for state management.
Responsive Design.
Typesafe via TypeScript.
challenges: Tailored platform specifically for Fantasy Premier League (FPL) enthusiasts, meeting niche market needs and demonstrating market awareness.

Overcame CORS problem for comprehensive data access, ensuring seamless functionality and user experience.

Continuously iterated on features and functionalities based on user feedback, improving overall platform experience and ensuring user satisfaction.

title: Adeptivity

title: Notopia
description: Notopia is my take on a note-taking app (since every developer has one), both for the web and desktop.
It features a block-style text editor (a simple Notion clone, if you will), relying on EditorJS library.
On the desktop, I used Electron, keeping things simple and using as few third-party libraries as possible.
descriptionShort: Short description for the sixth project.
features: Note-taking app for web and desktop – Notopia.
Block-style text editor reminiscent of a Notion clone.
Used local storage + custom hooks for data persistence.
Desktop version built with Electron, focusing on simplicity.
Minimal reliance on third-party libraries, with only EditorJS for editing.
Customized EditorJS's design to seamlessly fit into the project.
Straightforward and practical tool for efficient note-taking.
Implemented masonry layout without any third-party libraries.
